Welcome to Contacts app’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by executing a SQL query to check if it can connect to the database and retrieve data from it. If there is an error connecting, or retrieving data, then we raise an HTTPException with status code 500.

Parameters:

db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

main.index()¶

The index function is a Flask view function that returns a dictionary containing the message ‘Welcome to Contacts Application’. The index function is mapped to the ‘/’ URL by default. This means that when you visit this URL, the index function will be called and its return value will be used as the response.

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as: - Connecting to databases or other external services. - Loading configuration from files or environment variables. - Creating background tasks.

Returns:

A list of futures, so we need to wait for them

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.contacts.crud.congratulate(db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The congratulate function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass the database session

  • user – models.User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

async src.contacts.crud.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – contacts_schemas.ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – models.User: Identify the user that is making the request

Returns:

The contact object

async src.contacts.crud.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to delete

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass the database session

  • user – models.User: Ensure that the user is deleting their own contact

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.contacts.crud.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass the database session

  • user – models.User: Ensure that the user is only able to access their own contacts

Returns:

A contact object

async src.contacts.crud.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset for pagination

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – models.User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.contacts.crud.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The search_contacts function searches the contacts table for a user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Filter the contacts by a string

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – models.User: Filter the results by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.contacts.crud.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to update

  • body – contacts_schemas.ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

  • user – models.User: Ensure that the user is authorized to update the contact

Returns:

A contact object

REST API repository Auth¶

async src.auth.crud.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

None because it does not have a return statement

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.auth.crud.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – auth_schemas.UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.auth.crud.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.auth.crud.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – auth_models.User: Specify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Specify that the token parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.contacts.routes.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – contacts_schemas.ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – models.User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact that was just created

async src.contacts.routes.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – models.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object, which is the same as

async src.contacts.routes.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the path parameter, which is used to get a specific contact

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – models.User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.contacts.routes.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Specify the maximum value that can be passed to the limit parameter

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset number of contacts

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – models.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.contacts.routes.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a query string and returns a list of contacts that match the query. The user must be logged in to use this function.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for contacts with a specific name

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get a database connection

  • user – models.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.contacts.routes.upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – models.User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

async src.contacts.routes.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – contacts_schemas.ContactSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url path

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – models.User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.auth.routes.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an error message saying &quot;Verification error&quot;. If they do exist in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If their account has already been confirmed, then we return a message saying &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;. Otherwise (if their account hasn’t yet been confirmed),

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

async src.auth.routes.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, verifies them against those stored in the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A jwt token

async src.auth.routes.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the email of the user who sent it, then checks if that user exists in our database. If they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED). If they do exist, we create a new access_token and return it along with its type.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access_token and refresh_token

async src.auth.routes.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if there is already a confirmed account associated with that email address, and if so, returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.auth.routes.signup(body: UserSchema, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTP 409 Conflict error.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A user object, but the return type is not specified

REST API service Auth¶

class src.auth.services.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): A timedelta object representing the time until expiration of the token.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – typing.Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data, iat and exp

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the secret key, algorithm, and expiration date.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include at least a &quot;sub&quot; key, which is the subject of this token, and usually an &quot;id&quot; key with some unique identifier for that subject. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional expiration time, in seconds from now, for this token to expire in. If not provided, it will use 7 days as default value

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – typing.Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token which is encoded with the jwt library

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function decodes the refresh token and returns the email address of the user. If it fails to decode, it raises an HTTPException with a 401 status code.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token

Returns:

The email of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that returns the current user. It uses the OAuth2 Dependency to retrieve credentials from the Authorization header. If there are no credentials, or if they are invalid, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized). Otherwise, it gets and returns the user object from database.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – asyncio.AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, which is the same as the one we have in our database

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on instances of the class

  • plain_password – Check the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password with the plain_password

Returns:

True if the hashed password matches the plain text password

REST API service Email¶

async src.emails.services.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that they can click on within their browser.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Get the username of the user

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object
